pullRequest.title: feat(detectable): Pass blackduck proxy info to gradle inspector (IDET…
pullRequest.bodyText:
…ECT-1802)
Description
Created a class GradleInspectorProxyInfo, inserted it as a field to GradleInspectorOptions.
In GradleInspectorExtractor, passed data in GradleInspectorProxyInfo to arguments list in the same manner as the support workaround described in the ticket (IDETECT-1802) and as per this documentation: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/guides/net/proxies.html

commit.message: feat(detectable): Pass blackduck proxy info to gradle inspector (IDETECT-1802)

nodes.bodyText: We already have a class for storing proxy related information. It's called ProxyInfo
What about the other proxy properties? Such as blackduck.proxy.username, blackduck.proxy.password, blackduck.proxy.ntlm.workstation, blackduck.proxy.ntlm.domain

I would get the ProxyInfo from ConnectionManager if you can. 
  
    
      synopsys-detect/detect-configuration/src/main/java/com/synopsys/integration/detect/configuration/ConnectionManager.java
    
    
         Line 53
      in
      adf1481
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public ProxyInfo getBlackDuckProxyInfo() throws DetectUserFriendlyException {

commit.message: fix(detectable): Removed class GradleInspectorProxyInfo, GradleInspectionOptions now takes a ProxyInfo (IDETECT-1802)

nodes.bodyText: The current workaround for the customer is to add these arguments to the custom gradle build command. Will supplying multiple of the same arguments cause a problem with gradle? If so should we attempt to de-duplicate the argument the way we do the "dependencies" argument.
